summary: This is an email chain from November 30, 2018, between individuals with redacted email addresses at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The emails discuss coordinating a meeting to review a draft memo, being in touch with the FBI regarding the review of an old case file (likely related to Jeffrey Epstein), and reacting to a New York Times article.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Case Review
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinate a morning meeting to review a draft memo and discuss outstanding issues, including contact with the FBI regarding an old case file.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively discussing the Epstein case via email on November 30, 2018.
The office had drafted a memo and was in touch with the FBI, which was 'in the process of pulling/reviewing the old case file' related to Epstein.
The correspondence was prompted, in part, by 'Another article in the NYT today,' indicating ongoing media scrutiny influencing internal discussions.
All identifiable names and email addresses in the document are redacted, shown as strings like '(USANYS) alMIE>' or '(USANYS) cza'.
